snippet: Long-term Treasury bonds, not to mention European government bonds, have had a bumpy road. But analysts see strategies for finding a smoother ride in the overall market.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column points out that investors who have been fleeing jittery stocks and hiding out in the fixed-income market face a new quandary: finding something to ballast their Treasury and European bonds, which have experienced their own spike in volatility; observes that analysts see strategies for finding a smoother ride in the overall market.
lead_paragraph: Long-term Treasury bonds, not to mention European government bonds, have had a bumpy road. But analysts see strategies for finding a smoother ride in the overall market.

headline.seo: Bond Market Volatility and How to Fight It - Fundamentally
headline.main: Searching for Calm in Bond Markets
headline.print_headline: The Search For Calm In Bond Markets
